Properties.Description: A specific marketing event to support the objectives and goals of the associated Marketing Campaign.

NewEntity.Name: Order
NewEntity.Description: A document or commission by the customer to order products.

Columns.Name: OrderId
Columns.Description: The unique number that identifies an Order.

Columns.Name: OrderConfirmationNumber
Columns.Description: The order confirmation number provided to the Customer/Customer Account.

Columns.Name: OrderEnteredByEmployeeId
Columns.Description: The employee ID of the employee entering the Order into the order entry system.

Columns.Name: NumberOfOrderLines
Columns.Description: The number of Order Line Items associated with the Order.

Columns.Name: OrderReceivedTimestamp
Columns.Description: The timestamp that the Order was received from the Customer/Customer Account.

Columns.Name: OrderEntryTimestamp
Columns.Description: The date that the Order was entered into the order entry system.

Columns.Name: CustomerCreditCheckTimestamp
Columns.Description: The timestamp that the Customer/Customer Account had a credit check in regard to the Order amount.

Columns.Name: OrderConfirmationTimestamp
Columns.Description: The timestamp that the Order was confirmed to the Customer/Customer Account.

Columns.Name: OrderRequestedDeliveryDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Customer/Customer Account requested delivery of the Order.

Columns.Name: OrderCommittedDeliveryDate
Columns.Description: The date committed to the Customer/Customer Account for delivery of the Order.

Columns.Name: ShipmentConfirmationTimestamp
Columns.Description: The timestamp that confirmation of the Shipment was made to the Customer/Customer Account.

Columns.Name: OrderActualDeliveryTimestamp
Columns.Description: The actual timestamp of delivery of the Order to the Customer/Customer Account.

Columns.Name: OrderTotalRetailPriceAmount
Columns.Description: The total list price value of the ordered products = (list price per unit product price)x(quantity ordered) for each line item.

Columns.Name: OrderTotalActualSalesPriceAmount
Columns.Description: The total actual price value of the ordered products = (actual selling price per unit product price)x(quantity ordered) for each line item.

Columns.Name: OrderTotalAdjustmentPercentage
Columns.Description: The total percentage of adjustment applied to the Order.

Columns.Name: OrderTotalAdjustmentAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of adjustment applied to the Order.

Columns.Name: OrderTotalAmount
Columns.Description: The total value of the Order including Adjustment(s).

Columns.Name: TotalShippingChargeAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of shipping charge associated with the order.

Columns.Name: OrderTotalTaxAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of all taxes applied to the Order.

Columns.Name: OrderTotalInvoicedAmount
Columns.Description: The total invoiced amount to the Customer/Customer Account = (per units selling price of products)x(quantity purchased) for all line items + all discounts + all rebates + adjustments/credits + taxes

Columns.Name: TotalGratuityAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of gratuity paid.

Columns.Name: TotalPaidAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount including gratuity.

Columns.Name: TotalCommissionsPayableAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of commissions payable and due in regard to the Order.

Columns.Name: SplitCommissionsIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the commissions are to be split between two or more employees.

Columns.Name: OrderBookedDate
Columns.Description: The date signifying that the order has all the needed information to be considered a firm order and to be processed.

Columns.Name: OrderBilledDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Order was billed.

Columns.Name: OrderBacklogReportedDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Order backlog was reported.

Columns.Name: OrderBacklogReleasedDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Order backlog was released/fulfilled.

Columns.Name: OrderCancellationDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Order was cancelled.

Columns.Name: OrderReturnedDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Order was returned.

Columns.Name: ShipmentToName
Columns.Description: The name of the ship-to party.

Columns.Name: ShipmentToLocationId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Location.

Columns.Name: ShipmentId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Shipment.

Columns.Name: CarrierId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Carrier.

Columns.Name: ShipmentMethodId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Shipment Method.

Columns.Name: RequestedShipmentCarrierName
Columns.Description: The name of the Carrier for the Shipment requested by the Customer/Customer Account.

Columns.Name: AlternateCarrierAcceptableIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that an alternate Carrier of the Shipment would be acceptable to the Customer/Customer Account.

Columns.Name: ActualShipmentCarrierName
Columns.Description: The Carrier of the Shipment.

Columns.Name: ShipOrderCompleteIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the Order is only to be shipped when complete - no partial shipments.

Columns.Name: TotalOrderWeight
Columns.Description: The total weight of the Order.

Columns.Name: WeightUomId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Unit Of Measure.

Columns.Name: TotalOrderFreightChargeAmount
Columns.Description: The total order freight charges amount.

Columns.Description: The quantity billed.

Columns.Name: QuantityBacklog

Columns.Description: The quantity of Order Line Items returned.

Columns.Name: RequestedDeliveryDate

Columns.Description: The date committed for delivery of the Order Line Item.

NewEntity.Name: OrderType
NewEntity.Description:
A categorization of Orders based upon the time when they are to be fulfilled.

Ex:

ADVANCE ORDER
A sales order that is placed far in advance of the requested delivery date.

The buyer typically receives a discount when placing an Advance Order.

Often times Advanced Orders are placed when demand is low, which encourages the seller to grant a larger discount.

CURRENT ORDER
An Order that can be filled immediately because inventory is available.

BACK ORDER
An Order that cannot be filled due to lack of inventory and must be filled when inventory is available.

Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Order Type.

Columns.Name: OrderTypeName

NewEntity.Name: PurchaseOrder
NewEntity.Description:
Purchase orders are used in relatively simple transactions where minimal negotiations are required between the buyer and seller or where an existing agreement is in place. The seller states that products can be ordered with a purchase order.

The Purchase Order is an offer to the seller to contract on the terms offered and any such offer specifically limits acceptance by seller to the terms defined.

A Purchase Order is a contract between the buyer and seller that specifies the items to be purchased, price and date that the goods or services will be delivered.  The PO may also contain terms of purchase (STANDARD TERMS & CONDITIONS), specifications and quality levels.   It is the legal agreement between the buyer and supplier and the reference point for measuring supplier performance.   Changes to the Purchase Order may be made several points, PO Change Order (PURCHASING), and must be maintained for audit purposes.

Columns.Name: PoNumber
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Purchase Order.

Columns.Name: PoIssuedDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Purchase Order was issued.

Columns.Name: PoExpirationDate
Columns.Description: The expiration date of the Purchase Order after which it is invalid as an authorizing document.

Columns.Name: PoAcknowledgementDate
Columns.Description: The date that acceptance of a purchase order was received, which verifies the cost, description, quantity and ship date of goods ordered as well as special terms or conditions.

Columns.Name: PoAcceptanceDate
Columns.Description: The date that the purchase order was accepted, which verifies the cost, description, quantity and ship date of goods ordered as well as special terms or conditions.

Columns.Name: PoAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of products that the Purchase Order authorizes purchase of.

Columns.Name: PoProductAmount
Columns.Description: The total product value of the PO exclusive of taxes, freight and any other costs.

Columns.Name: PoTaxAmount
Columns.Description: The total tax due on the PO items.

Columns.Name: PoFreightAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of freight due for the PO items.

Columns.Name: BlanketPoIndicator
Columns.Description: An indicator or flag denoting the PO is a 'blanket PO' that may be used to fulfill multiple Requisitions.

Columns.Name: RequestedDeliveryDate
Columns.Description: The requested delivery date of the requisitioned items.

Columns.Name: ConfirmedDeliveryDate
Columns.Description: The confirmed delivery date by the vendor pending the associated PO.

Columns.Name: ActualDeliveryDate
Columns.Description: The actual delivery date of the requisitioned items.

Columns.Name: ShipToName
Columns.Description: The name of the person or organization that the PO items are to be shipped to (if different from the buyers).

Columns.Name: ShipToLocationId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Location.

Columns.Name: ShipToWarehouseId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Warehouse.

Columns.Name: PoTrainingTerms
Columns.Description: A statement describing the Training Terms associated with acquisition of the associated Items under the PO.

Columns.Name: PoSupportTerms
Columns.Description: A statement describing the Support Terms associated with acquisition of the associated Items under the PO.

Columns.Name: PoCreatedByName
Columns.Description: The name of the person who created the PO.

Columns.Name: PoInstallationTerms
Columns.Description: A statement describing the Installation Terms associated with acquisition of the associated Items under the PO.

Columns.Name: PoAcceptanceTerms
Columns.Description: A statement describing the Acceptance Terms associated with acquisition of the associated Items under the PO.

Columns.Name: PoSparePartsTerms
Columns.Description: A statement describing the Spare Parts Terms associated with acquisition of the associated Items under the PO.

Columns.Name: PoLicensesAndPermitsTerms
Columns.Description: A statement describing the Licenses And Permits Terms associated with acquisition of the associated Items under the PO.

Columns.Name: PoInsuranceTerms
Columns.Description: A statement describing the Insurance Terms associated with acquisition of the associated Items under the PO.

Columns.Name: PoTimeAndPenaltiesTerms
Columns.Description: A statement describing the Time And Penalties Terms associated with acquisition of the associated Items under the PO.

Columns.Name: PoAcceptanceSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes what constitutes acceptance of the terms of the Purchase Order.

Columns.Name: PoDeliverySection
Columns.Description:
This section assigns to the buyer the right to cancel an order if it is not delivered by the date on the face of the purchase order.

This section also addresses the packing and shipping by the proper carrier of PO items.

Columns.Name: PoPriceAndPaymentSection
Columns.Description:
This section establishes whether the states price included packing and transportation to the FOB point, the location where the buyer takes responsibility for the goods.

FOB stands for "Free On Board' - designating a point or location where seller must deliver goods to a carrier for shipment.   Typically the seller pays for delivering goods to the designated FOB location and the buyer bears responsibility for costs or losses to goods having reached the FOB point.

This section also establishes whether the buyer will pay any charges that are not shown on the PO.

Columns.Name: PoTerminationSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes the terms and conditions under which the buyer can cancel an order.

Columns.Name: PoIntellectualPropertyRightsSection
Columns.Description: This section specifies provisions to protect the buyer against any claims of unauthorized use or infringement that may result from the sale of the products or goods.   The Seller may be responsible for defending all claims brought against the buyer for infringement or unauthorized use of goods and may have to pay all damages that result from such claims.

Columns.Name: PoQualityAssuranceSection
Columns.Description:
This section establishes how goods are sold - "as is", "with warranty", "without warranty".

Certain warranties may be provided by law even though they are not states explicitly in the document.

Columns.Name: PoDefectiveGoodsSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes the buyers rights and remedies in case the goods do not conform to the terms and conditions of the Purchase Order.

Columns.Name: PoExcessGoodsSection
Columns.Description: This section provides that goods shipped in excess of the amount ordered by the buyer will not be accepted and seller will bear risk, responsibility and expense for their return.

Columns.Name: PoInspectionAndAcceptanceSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes the buyer's right to inspect all goods and adjust those goods that do not conform to the terms of the Purchase Order.

Columns.Name: PoFabricationAndMaterialCommitmentSection
Columns.Description: This section address the situation where the sale of goods is improperly canceled by a buyer and the seller may be entitled to damages.

Columns.Name: PoLegalComplianceSection
Columns.Description: This section is intended to demonstrate compliance with some state or federal law or regulation.

Columns.Name: PoBuyersPropertySection
Columns.Description: This section establishes protection for any property provided by the buyer to the seller for use in fulfilling the buyer's order.

Columns.Name: PoTaxSection
Columns.Description: This section provides that the purchase price of the goods does not include any sales taxes and that the seller must separately state applicable taxes on the seller's invoice.   Buyer remains responsible for paying any sales tax.

Columns.Name: PoAssignmentSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes that the seller may not transfer any rights or obligations related to the Purchase Order to anyone else without the buyer's prior consent.

Columns.Name: PoRemediesSection
Columns.Description: This section establishes how any dispute regarding the Purchase Order will be resolved and the legal remedies that may be sought by either party.

Columns.Name: PurchaseOrderStatusTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of the PO Status.

Columns.Name: RequisitionId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of the Requisition.

Columns.Name: VendorOrderReferenceNumber
Columns.Description: This is the Reference Number that the vendor has assigned to their internal sales order number that corresponds to this purchase.

Columns.Name: PoServicesProcurementSpecification
Columns.Description: A specification or description of the specifications or details regarding acquisition of services in relation to the PO.

Columns.Name: ResponsibilityCenterId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Responsibility Center.

Columns.Name: PurchaseOrderTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Purchase Order Type.

Columns.Name: ContractId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Contract.

Columns.Name: VendorId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Vendor.

Columns.Name: CustomerId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Customer.

Columns.Name: DocumentId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Document.

Columns.Name: IsoCurrencyCode
Columns.Description: The ISO 4217 currency code.

Columns.Name: ShipmentMethodId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Shipment Method.

Properties.Description:
Purchase orders are used in relatively simple transactions where minimal negotiations are required between the buyer and seller or where an existing agreement is in place. The seller states that products can be ordered with a purchase order.

The Purchase Order is an offer to the seller to contract on the terms offered and any such offer specifically limits acceptance by seller to the terms defined.

A Purchase Order is a contract between the buyer and seller that specifies the items to be purchased, price and date that the goods or services will be delivered.  The PO may also contain terms of purchase (STANDARD TERMS & CONDITIONS), specifications and quality levels.   It is the legal agreement between the buyer and supplier and the reference point for measuring supplier performance.   Changes to the Purchase Order may be made several points, PO Change Order (PURCHASING), and must be maintained for audit purposes.

NewEntity.Name: ServiceRequestReason
NewEntity.Description:
A request for services made by a party.

A Service Request may be addressed immediately or require additional activity(s) or Service Request Activity(s).

Both Service Request(s) and Service Request Activity(s) involve one or more parties of various types and responsibilities and may incur costs that are charged internally or to the party.

A Service Request may be raised to an Issue if it can not be resolved or required higher visibility.

Properties.Description:
A request for services made by a party.

A Service Request may be addressed immediately or require additional activity(s) or Service Request Activity(s).

Both Service Request(s) and Service Request Activity(s) involve one or more parties of various types and responsibilities and may incur costs that are charged internally or to the party.

A Service Request may be raised to an Issue if it can not be resolved or required higher visibility.

NewEntity.Name: Shipment
NewEntity.Description: A quantity of items, goods or bulk cargo that are shipped together.

Columns.Name: ShipmentId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Shipment.

Columns.Name: MasterShipmentNumber
Columns.Description: A master shipment number is used to tie multiple shipments together. It is typically used when one or more shipments are to be considered to be a single shipment for billing purposes.

Columns.Name: TrackingIdentifier
Columns.Description: A tracking identifier is a number or alphanumeric string consisting of a series of numbers and letters, used to uniquely identify a handling unit associated with a shipment.

Columns.Name: ShipmentBookingNumber
Columns.Description: Reservation number used to secure equipment and act as a control number prior to completion of a B/L.

Columns.Name: ExportLicenseNumber
Columns.Description: An export license number that may be associated with the shipment.

Columns.Name: InsurancePolicyId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Insurance Policy.

Columns.Name: GlobalShipmentIdentificationNumber
Columns.Description:
The Global Shipment Identification Number (GSIN) is part of the GS1 system of standards. It is used to identify shipments.

A shipment, which may be comprised of one or more logistic units, is intended to be delivered together. The logistic units belonging to a particular shipment keep the same GSIN during all transport stages, from origin to final destination.

Columns.Name: GlobalIdentificationNumberForConsignment
Columns.Description:
The Global Identification Number for Consignment (GINC) is part of the GS1 system of standards. It is used to identify a grouping of goods that has been consigned to a freight forwarder and is intended to be transported as a single group. 

GINC is used to identify consignments comprised of one or more logistic units, potentially belonging to different shipments, that are intended to be transported together for a portion of their transportation journey. This typically occurs when shipments are consolidated.

Columns.Name: ShipmentOrderId
Columns.Description: The unique number that identifies an Order.

Columns.Name: ShipmentOrderLineNumber
Columns.Description: The number that identifies the Order Line Item.

Columns.Name: ConsignorName
Columns.Description: The name of the person or firm whose name appears on the air waybill as the party contracting with the carrier for carriage of the goods.  Usually the shipper.

Columns.Name: ConsignorPartyId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Party.

Columns.Name: ConsignorCustomerAccountId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Customer Account.

Columns.Name: ConsignorLocationId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Location.

Columns.Name: ConsignorSignatureImage
Columns.Description: The consignor's signature or signature image.

Columns.Name: ConsigneeName
Columns.Description: The Consignee is the person or legal entity in a freight contract to whom goods have been shipped or turned over to care.

Columns.Name: ConsigneePartyId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Party.

Columns.Name: ConsigneeCustomerAccountId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Customer Account.

Columns.Name: ConsigneeLocationId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Location.

Columns.Name: ConsigneeSignatureImage
Columns.Description: The consignee's signature or signature image.

Columns.Name: NotifyPartyId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Party.

Columns.Name: ShipmentFromName
Columns.Description: The name of the ship-from party.

Columns.Name: ShipmentFromLocationId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Location.

Columns.Name: OriginationWarehouseId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Warehouse.

Columns.Name: ShipmentToName
Columns.Description: The name of the ship-to party.

Columns.Name: ShipmentToLocationId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Location.

Columns.Name: DestinationWarehouseId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Warehouse.

Columns.Name: ShipmentConditionId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Shipment Condition.

Columns.Name: ShipmentTotalNetWeight
Columns.Description: Net Weight - The total weight of a shipment less the weight of containers, pallets, nets or straps.

Columns.Name: ShipmentTotalGrossWeight
Columns.Description:
The full weight of a shipment including goods and packaging.

The weight of the shipment including all packing, blocking, platforms, special bracing, etc., if required. (includes weight of unit load device, when applicable.)

Columns.Name: ShipmentTotalChargeableWeight
Columns.Description:
The weight of the shipment used in determining shipment charges. 

The chargeable weight may be the dimensional weight, or on container shipments, the gross weight of the shipment less the tare weight of the container.

Columns.Name: PackingInstructions
Columns.Description: Instructions for shipping personnel regarding the associated Shipment.

Columns.Name: DeliveryInstructions
Columns.Description: Specific information provided to the inland carrier concerning the arrangement made by the Freight Forwarder to deliver items to the particular pier or steamship line.

Columns.Name: ArrangementsInAdvanceInstructions
Columns.Description: Certain commodities, such as gold, gems, live animals etc., require arrangements to be made in advance with the Carriers.

Columns.Name: DeclarationByForeignShipperStatement
Columns.Description: A statement by the Shipper in the foreign country attesting to certain facts.

Columns.Name: HiddenDamageStatement
Columns.Description: The statement regarding to any hidden damages allocated to the Shipment.

Columns.Name: ArrivalNoticeStatement
Columns.Description: An advice that the carrier sends to the consignee advising of goods coming forward for delivery. Pertinent information such as BL number, container number and total charges due from consignee etc., are included and sent to consignee prior to vessel arrival. This is done gratuitously by the carrier to ensure smooth delivery but there is no obligation by the carrier to do so. The responsibility to monitor the transit and present himself to take timely delivery still rests with the consignee.

Columns.Name: EstimatedShipmentCost
Columns.Description: The estimated total shipment cost amount.

Columns.Name: ShipmentAgreedValuationAmount
Columns.Description: The value of a shipment agreed upon in order to secure a specific freight rate.

Columns.Name: ShipmentCarrierLiabilityAmount
Columns.Description: The amount of declared value on a shipment that is over the carrier's liability

Columns.Name: ShipmentAllInAmount
Columns.Description: The total price to move cargo from origin to destination, inclusive of all charges.

Columns.Name: ShipmentExcessValueAmount
Columns.Description: The amount of declared value on a shipment that is over the carrier's liability

Columns.Name: ShipmentTotalChargesAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of all charges associated with the shipment.

Columns.Name: CollectOnDeliveryIndicator
Columns.Description:
Indicates that the shipment is collect.

A transportation service under which the purchase price of the goods in collected by the carrier from the receiver at the time of delivery. Payment Is subsequently transmitted to the shipper. Carriers charge a nominal fee for this service. Payment is due upon delivery. There are no credit provisions in COD service.

Columns.Name: AutomaticProofOfDeliveryRequiredIndicator
Columns.Description:
Indicates that a POD is required.

An Automatic Proof of Delivery (POD)  is information automatically sent to payer containing name of person who signed for the package with timestamp of delivery.

Columns.Name: HoldForPickupShipmentIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that freight is to be held at the carrier's destination location for pickup by the recipient.

Columns.Name: AstrayShipmentIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the shipment is traveling without paperwork or on paperwork in place of the original

Columns.Name: InterlineShipmentIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the shipment requires the movement of a shipment via two or more carriers.

Columns.Name: IntermodalShipmentIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the shipment requires the movement of goods by more than one mode of Transport, i.e. railroad, truck, ship and airplane, in the same ULD, under a singe waybill.

Columns.Name: PrePaidShipmentIndicator
Columns.Description: Freight and charges are required to be paid by shipper before original bill of lading is released to them.

Columns.Name: WithoutReserveShipmentIndicator
Columns.Description: A term indicating that a shipper's agent or representative is empowered to make definitive decisions and adjustments abroad without approval of the group or individual represented

Columns.Name: NotifyOnArrivalIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the consignor requires to be notified upon receipt of the shipment.

Columns.Name: DoorToDoorShipmentIndicator
Columns.Description: Through transportation of a container and its contents from consignor's premises to consignee's premises.

Columns.Name: ConsolidatedShipmentIndicator
Columns.Description: Numerous shipments from different shippers to one consignee that are consolidated and treated as a single consignment.

Columns.Name: UnclaimedShipmentIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the shipment has been unclaimed.

Columns.Name: PartialShipmentAcceptableIndicator
Columns.Description: An indicator denoting that the customer has agreed to partial shipments.

Columns.Name: EstimatedNumberDeliveryDays
Columns.Description: The estimated number of days to deliver the Shipment.

Columns.Name: LatestAvailableShipDate
Columns.Description: The latest ship date that is acceptable to the customer.

Columns.Name: ShipmentTenderTimestamp
Columns.Description: The timestamp that the shipment was tendered or place or shipment.

Columns.Name: PlannedEarliestPickUpTimestamp
Columns.Description: The earliest that the shipment can be picked up.

Columns.Name: PlannedLatestPickUpTimestamp
Columns.Description: The latest that the shipment can be picked-up.

Columns.Name: PlannedEarliestDeliveryTimestamp
Columns.Description: The earliest that the shipment can be delivered.

Columns.Name: PlannedLatestDeliveryTimestamp
Columns.Description: The latest that the shipment can be delivered.

Columns.Name: PlannedShipTimestamp
Columns.Description: The planned date of shipment.

Columns.Name: ActualShipTimestamp
Columns.Description: The actual shipment date.

Columns.Name: CleanBillOfLadingTimestamp
Columns.Description: The date that a clear bill of lading was determined, which is a receipt for goods issued by the Carrier indicating that the goods were received in good order and condition, without damages.

Columns.Name: ReleaseNoteTimestamp
Columns.Description: Receipt signed by customer acknowledging delivery of goods.

Columns.Name: EstimatedDeliveryTimestamp
Columns.Description: Estimated delivery timestamp.

Columns.Name: ShipmentDeliveryTimestamp
Columns.Description: The timestamp that the shipment was received or delivered at the ship-to address.

Columns.Name: ArrivalNoticeIssuedTimestamp
Columns.Description:
The date that the Arrival Notice was issued or sent.

An advice that the carrier sends to the consignee advising of goods coming forward for delivery. Pertinent information such as BL number, container number and total charges due from consignee etc., are included and sent to consignee prior to vessel arrival. This is done gratuitously by the carrier to ensure smooth delivery but there is no obligation by the carrier to do so. The responsibility to monitor the transit and present himself to take timely delivery still rests with the consignee.

Columns.Name: AutomaticProofOfDeliveryPodIssuedTimestamp
Columns.Description: The date that the automatic proof of delivery (POD) was issued.

Columns.Name: PackingTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Packing Type.

Columns.Name: ShipmentTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Shipment Type.

Columns.Name: ShipmentPriorityId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Shipment Priority.

Columns.Name: ShipmentMethodId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Shipment Method.

Columns.Name: IncotermId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Incoterm.

Columns.Name: CarrierId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Carrier.

Columns.Name: RequestedCarrierId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Carrier.

Columns.Name: ChannelId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Channel.

Columns.Name: ContainerId
Columns.Description:
The unique identifier of the container.

This would be the 'serial number' of the container if it is serialized.

Columns.Name: PalletTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Pallet Type.

Columns.Name: PalletSerialNumber
Columns.Description: The serial number of the Pallet.

Columns.Name: ItemSku
Columns.Description: The Stock Keeping Unit identifier, which is typically used for inventory-related activities.

Columns.Name: ShipmentHeight
Columns.Description: The height of the Shipment.

Columns.Name: ShipmentWidth
Columns.Description: The width of the Shipment.

Columns.Name: ShipmentLength
Columns.Description: The length of the Shipment.

Columns.Name: ShipmentNetWeight
Columns.Description: The weight of the Shipment.

Columns.Name: ShipmentVolume
Columns.Description: The volume of the shipment.

Columns.Name: VolumeUnitOfMeasureId
Columns.Description:
Note:
A temporary divider header that is used to separate and organize information for the viewer.

This column is marked 'Logical Only' and is therefore 'for presentation only' and will not be used when generating DDL.

Columns.Name: LengthWidthHeightUnitOfMeasureId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Unit Of Measure.

Columns.Name: WeightUnitOfMeasureId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Unit Of Measure.

Columns.Name: TimeSpentAtDeliveryLocation
Columns.Description: The amount of time spent at the ship-to address to deliver the shipment.

Columns.Name: IsoCurrencyCode
Columns.Description: The ISO 4217 currency code.

NewEntity.Name: ShipmentMethod
NewEntity.Description:
The method by which the shipment is to be shipped.

Ex:
- Air - general air cargo
- Air - next day air
- Air - overnight air
- Barge
- Fast Freight
- Piggyback Service
- Pipeline
- Rail
- Ship
- Tanker
- Truck
- Transloading Privilege
- Vessel

NewEntity.Name: SourceDocument

The source document is the original record of a transaction.     

Source documents are important as evidence of the business transaction is case proof is required (ex: audit).

Columns.Name: TransactionId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Transaction.

Columns.Name: InvoiceId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Invoice.

Columns.Name: OrderId
Columns.Description: The unique number that identifies an Order.

NewEntity.Name: Transaction
NewEntity.Description:
The lowest level of executable work or customer activity.

A transaction consists of one or more discrete events.

Columns.Name: TransactionId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Transaction.

Columns.Name: TransactionInitiatedTimestamp
Columns.Description: The timestamp the transaction was initiated.

Columns.Name: TransactionCompletedTimestamp
Columns.Description: The timestamp that the transaction was completed or closed.

Columns.Name: TransactionReceivedTimestamp
Columns.Description: The timestamp that the Transaction was received.

Columns.Name: TransactionEntryTimestamp
Columns.Description: The timestamp that the Transaction was entered into the appropriate system for processing.

Columns.Name: TransactionConfirmationTimestamp
Columns.Description: The timestamp that the Transaction was confirmed to the Customer/Customer Account.

Columns.Name: CreditCheckTimestamp
Columns.Description: The timestamp that the Customer/Customer Account had a credit check in regard to the Transaction amount.

Columns.Name: RequestedDeliveryDate
Columns.Description: The date that the Customer/Customer Account requested delivery of the items.

Columns.Name: CommittedDeliveryDate
Columns.Description: The date committed to the Customer/Customer Account for delivery of the items.

Columns.Name: ActualDeliveryTimestamp
Columns.Description: The actual timestamp of delivery of the items to the Customer/Customer Account.

Columns.Name: DeliveryConfirmationTimestamp
Columns.Description: The timestamp that confirmation of the delivery or Shipment was made to the Customer/Customer Account.

Columns.Name: TransactionAmount
Columns.Description:
The amount associated with the transaction.

Ex:
Refund = 'amount'
Credit = 'amount'

Columns.Name: ShipmentToName
Columns.Description: The name of the ship-to party.

Columns.Name: ShipmentToLocationId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Location.

Columns.Name: TransactionConfirmationNumber
Columns.Description: The transaction confirmation number provided to confirm that the transaction was executed.

Columns.Name: IdentificationCheckedIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates whether the individual's identification was checked for any requirements for the transaction. For example: The individual is 21 years of age or older in order to purchase alcohol products.

Columns.Name: IdentificationId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of the identification.

Columns.Name: TotalRetailPriceAmount
Columns.Description: The total list price value of the Transaction products = (list price per unit product price)x(quantity ordered) for each line item.

Columns.Name: TotalAdjustmentPercentage
Columns.Description: The total percentage of adjustment(s) applied to the Transaction.

Columns.Name: TotalAdjustmentAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of adjustments applied to the Transaction.

Columns.Name: TotalTransactionSalesPriceAmount
Columns.Description: The total actual price value of the transaction item(s) = (actual selling price per unit product price)x(quantity) for each line item.

Columns.Name: TotalShippingChargeAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of shipping charge associated with the Transaction.

Columns.Name: TransactionTotalTaxAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of all taxes applied to the Transaction.

Columns.Name: TransactionRoundingAmount
Columns.Description: The amount of rounding applied to the transaction. This is typically done when the payment method is cash and the total invoice amount is rounded to an amount that is payable using legal tender. (e.g. 1 cent coin is no longer in legal circulation.)

Columns.Name: TransactionTotalInvoicedAmount
Columns.Description: The total invoiced amount to the Customer/Customer Account.

Columns.Name: TotalCommissionsPayableAmount
Columns.Description: The total amount of commissions payable and due in regard to the Transaction.

Columns.Name: SplitCommissionsIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the commissions are to be split between two or more employees.

Columns.Name: RequestedShipmentCarrierName
Columns.Description: The name of the Carrier for the Shipment requested by the Customer/Customer Account.

Columns.Name: AlternateCarrierAcceptableIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that an alternate Carrier of the Shipment would be acceptable to the Customer/Customer Account.

Columns.Name: ShipCompleteIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the Transaction item(s) are only to be shipped when complete - no partial shipments.

Columns.Name: AcknowledgementRequiredIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that an acknowledgement  to the Customer/Customer Account is required for the Transaction.

Columns.Name: ExpediteTransactionIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the Transaction is to be expedited.

Columns.Name: DropShipmentIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that the Transaction item(s) are to be drop shipped.

Columns.Name: ActualShipmentCarrierName
Columns.Description: The Carrier of the Shipment.

Columns.Name: TotalWeight
Columns.Description: The total weight of the Transaction item(s).

Columns.Name: TotalFreightChargeAmount
Columns.Description: The total freight charges amount.

Columns.Name: UnitOfMeasureId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Unit Of Measure.

Columns.Name: EarliestDeliveryWindowTimestamp
Columns.Description: The earliest timestamp that the transaction should be made available for delivery.

Columns.Name: LatestDeliveryWindowTimestamp
Columns.Description: The latest timestamp that the transaction should be made available for delivery.

Columns.Name: DeliveryInstructions
Columns.Description: Instructions related to the delivery of the Transaction item(s).

Columns.Name: CustomerCreditCheckNote
Columns.Description: A note, comment or additional information regarding the Transaction credit check.

Columns.Name: MessageToCustomer
Columns.Description: A message to the Customer/Customer Account regarding the Transaction.

Columns.Name: CustomerId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Customer.

Columns.Name: CustomerAccountId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Customer Account.

Columns.Name: PurchasingChannelId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Channel.

Columns.Name: SalesChannelId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Channel.

Columns.Name: DistributionChannelId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Channel.

Columns.Name: MarketingEventId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Marketing Event.

Columns.Name: AdvertisingEventId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Advertising Event.

Columns.Name: PromotionId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Promotion.

Columns.Name: PartialReturnIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that only a part of the original transaction was returned or refunded.

Columns.Name: TransactionTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Transaction Type.

Columns.Name: BillingCycleId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Billing Cycle.

Columns.Name: MerchantId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Merchant.

Columns.Name: CustomerIdentificationMethodId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a customer identification method.

Columns.Name: TransactionClassificationId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of an Transaction Classification.

Columns.Name: TransactionProcessingStatusId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Transaction Processing Status.

Columns.Name: IsoCurrencyCode
Columns.Description: The ISO 4217 currency code.

Columns.Name: TransactionExecutionMethodId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Transaction Execution Type.

Columns.Name: TransactionPriorityId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Transaction Priority.

Columns.Name: TransactionTaxStatusId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Transaction Tax Status.

Columns.Name: WebpageUrl
Columns.Description:
The unique address of any Web document.

The URL consists of:
Type of file (ex: http://)
Domain name (ex: www. name.com)
Path or directory to file (ex: /notes/internet)
Name of file (...name.html)

Columns.Name: SessionId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Session.

Columns.Name: WorkstationSessionId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Workstation Session.

Columns.Name: PointOfSaleId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a POS.

Columns.Name: StoreId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Store.

Columns.Name: WarehouseId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Warehouse.

Columns.Name: ResponsibilityCenterId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Responsibility Center.

Columns.Name: TransactionNote
Columns.Description: A note, comment or additional information regarding the Transaction.

Columns.Name: ShipmentMethodId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Shipment Method.

Columns.Name: DeviceId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Device.

Columns.Name: SoftwareProductId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a software product.

Columns.Name: UnitOfMeasureId

Columns.Name: UnitOfMeasureDescription

Columns.Name: UnitOfMeasureTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Unit Of Measure Type.

Columns.Name: MetricIndicator

Columns.Name: UnitOfMeasurePrefixId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Unit Of Measure Prefix.

Columns.Name: BaseUnitOfMeasureId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Unit Of Measure.

Columns.Name: NumberOfBaseUnits
Columns.Description: The number of base units that make up the Unit Of Measure.

Columns.Name: UnitOfMeasureNote
Columns.Description: A note, comment or additional information regarding the Unit Of Measure.

NewEntity.Name: Vendor
NewEntity.Description: A supplier of products, goods or services.

Columns.Name: VendorId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Vendor.

Columns.Name: VendorName
Columns.Description: The business name of the Vendor.

Columns.Name: VendorNote
Columns.Description: A narrative, description or additional detail regarding the associated Vendor.

Columns.Name: VendorTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Vendor Type.

Columns.Name: VendorDateOfEstablishment
Columns.Description: The date that the Vendor was established.

Columns.Name: StateOfVendorEstablishment
Columns.Description: The state in which the Vendor was established.

Columns.Name: CountryOfVendorEstablishment
Columns.Description: The country in which the Vendor was established.

Columns.Name: StateOfVendorResidence
Columns.Description: The state in which the Vendor has it's primary business or official residence.

Columns.Name: CountryOfVendorResidence
Columns.Description: The country in which the Vendor has it's primary business or official residence.

Columns.Name: FirstDateOfOperation
Columns.Description: The first date that the Vendor entered into normal business or operations.

Columns.Name: CurrentManagementFirstControlDate
Columns.Description: The date that current management assumed control of the Vendor's normal business operations.

Columns.Name: StockExchangeName
Columns.Description: The name of the stock exchange that the security is listed upon.

Columns.Name: ListedSecuritySymbol
Columns.Description: The security symbol of the Vendor, if any.

Columns.Name: BankruptcyIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that bankruptcy proceeding exist for the Vendor customer, which is a proceeding under the U.S. Bankruptcy Code, in which either a debtor files a bankruptcy petition and voluntarily seeks protection from creditors, or creditors file a bankruptcy petition against a debtor to force the debtor to pay debts owed to them.

Columns.Name: SmallBusinessIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates that business is a small business by SBA guidelines.

Columns.Name: ManufacturingIndicator
Columns.Description: Notes manufacturing operations occur at site.

Columns.Name: ForeignOwnedIndicator
Columns.Description: Identifies companies with parent outside of the U.S.

Columns.Name: DunsNumber
Columns.Description: The DUNS number is a nine-digit number issued by Dun & Bradstreet and assigned to each business location in the D&B database having a unique, separate, and distinct operation to businesses for the purpose of identifying them. The number as issued is random and the digits apparently have no significance as to their issuance.

Columns.Name: DunBradstreetSingleLocationSubsidiary
Columns.Description:
There are eight (8) types of business relationships defined in D&B WorldBase:

Single Location Subsidiary

A single location subsidiary has reporting responsibilities to its parent; however, it does not have branches or subsidiaries reporting to it. Do not confuse this with a stand-alone business which is titled "single location" and is not part of a corporate family.

Headquarters

A headquarters is a business establishment that has branches or divisions reporting to it, and is financially responsible for those branches or divisions. If the headquarters is more that 50% owned by another corporation, it also will be a subsidiary. If it owns more that 50% of another corporation, then it is also a parent.

Branch

A branch is a secondary location of its headquarters. It has no legal responsibility for its debts, even though bills may be paid from the branch location. It will have the same legal business name as its headquarters, although branches frequently operate under a different trade style than the headquarters establishment. A branch may be located at the same address as the headquarters if it has a unique trade style. In such cases, the branch may appear to be a duplicate with a different D-U-N-S number than the headquarters record, which may confuse customers if they don't purchase the trade style field.

Division

A division, like a branch, is a secondary location of a business. However, a division carries out specific business operations related to the headquarters under a divisional name. Divisions look similar to branches in D&B WorldBase and carry a branch code.

Subsidiary

A subsidiary is a corporation that is more than 50% owned by another corporation and will have a different legal business name from its parent company. A subsidiary may have branches and/or subsidiaries of its own. If it does, then its D-U-N-S Number appears in the headquarter/parent D-U-N-S Number field of its children.

Parent

A parent is a corporation that owns more than 50 percent of another corporation. The parent company also may be a subsidiary of another corporation. If the parent also has branches, then it is also a headquarters.

Domestic Ultimate

The Domestic Ultimate is a subsidiary within the global family tree which is the highest ranking member within a specific country.

Global Ultimate

The Global Ultimate is the top most responsible entity within the global family tree. The Global Ultimate may have branches and/or subsidiaries reporting directly or indirectly to it.

Columns.Name: DunBradstreetHeadquarters
Columns.Description:
There are eight (8) types of business relationships defined in D&B WorldBase:

Single Location Subsidiary

A single location subsidiary has reporting responsibilities to its parent; however, it does not have branches or subsidiaries reporting to it. Do not confuse this with a stand-alone business which is titled "single location" and is not part of a corporate family.

Headquarters

A headquarters is a business establishment that has branches or divisions reporting to it, and is financially responsible for those branches or divisions. If the headquarters is more that 50% owned by another corporation, it also will be a subsidiary. If it owns more that 50% of another corporation, then it is also a parent.

Branch

A branch is a secondary location of its headquarters. It has no legal responsibility for its debts, even though bills may be paid from the branch location. It will have the same legal business name as its headquarters, although branches frequently operate under a different trade style than the headquarters establishment. A branch may be located at the same address as the headquarters if it has a unique trade style. In such cases, the branch may appear to be a duplicate with a different D-U-N-S number than the headquarters record, which may confuse customers if they don't purchase the trade style field.

Division

A division, like a branch, is a secondary location of a business. However, a division carries out specific business operations related to the headquarters under a divisional name. Divisions look similar to branches in D&B WorldBase and carry a branch code.

Subsidiary

A subsidiary is a corporation that is more than 50% owned by another corporation and will have a different legal business name from its parent company. A subsidiary may have branches and/or subsidiaries of its own. If it does, then its D-U-N-S Number appears in the headquarter/parent D-U-N-S Number field of its children.

Parent

A parent is a corporation that owns more than 50 percent of another corporation. The parent company also may be a subsidiary of another corporation. If the parent also has branches, then it is also a headquarters.

Domestic Ultimate

The Domestic Ultimate is a subsidiary within the global family tree which is the highest ranking member within a specific country.

Global Ultimate

The Global Ultimate is the top most responsible entity within the global family tree. The Global Ultimate may have branches and/or subsidiaries reporting directly or indirectly to it.

Branch

A branch is a secondary location of its headquarters. It has no legal responsibility for its debts, even though bills may be paid from the branch location. It will have the same legal business name as its headquarters, although branches frequently operate under a different trade style than the headquarters establishment. A branch may be located at the same address as the headquarters if it has a unique trade style. In such cases, the branch may appear to be a duplicate with a different D-U-N-S number than the headquarters record, which may confuse customers if they don't purchase the trade style field.

Division

A division, like a branch, is a secondary location of a business. However, a division carries out specific business operations related to the headquarters under a divisional name. Divisions look similar to branches in D&B WorldBase and carry a branch code.

Subsidiary

A subsidiary is a corporation that is more than 50% owned by another corporation and will have a different legal business name from its parent company. A subsidiary may have branches and/or subsidiaries of its own. If it does, then its D-U-N-S Number appears in the headquarter/parent D-U-N-S Number field of its children.

Parent

A parent is a corporation that owns more than 50 percent of another corporation. The parent company also may be a subsidiary of another corporation. If the parent also has branches, then it is also a headquarters.

Domestic Ultimate

The Domestic Ultimate is a subsidiary within the global family tree which is the highest ranking member within a specific country.

Global Ultimate

The Global Ultimate is the top most responsible entity within the global family tree. Properties.Description: A supplier of products, goods or services.

NewEntity.Name: Warehouse
NewEntity.Description:
A structure designated for storage of things or items.
A 'warehouse' is synonymous with 'stockroom'.

Columns.Name: WarehouseId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Warehouse.

Columns.Name: WarehouseName
Columns.Description: The name of the Warehouse.

Columns.Name: LocationId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Location.

Columns.Name: GlobalLocationNumber
Columns.Description: The Global Location Number (GLN) is a simple tool used to uniquely identify locations. It can be used to identify physical locations such as a warehouse, legal entities, or a function / department within a legal entity. The GLN is part of the GS1 system of standards.

Columns.Name: WarehouseTelephoneNumber
Columns.Description: The Warehouse Telephone Number.

Columns.Name: WarehouseFaxNumber
Columns.Description: The Warehouse Fax Number.

Columns.Name: WarehouseEmailAddress
Columns.Description: The Warehouse email address.

Columns.Name: PickAndPackLeadTime
Columns.Description: The default time required to pick and pack an item at a warehouse.

Columns.Name: WarehouseOrderCutoffTime
Columns.Description: The latest time each day that new orders will be accepted for delivery for the next scheduled delivery day.

Columns.Name: TotalFloorSpace
Columns.Description: The total floor space at the Warehouse.

Columns.Name: TotalFloorInventoryStorageSpace
Columns.Description: The total floor space at the Warehouse that is available for storage of inventory.

Columns.Name: StorageSpaceUnitOfMeasureId
Columns.Description:
The unit of measure for the size measurement of the Warehouse.

Ex:
- square feet
- square meter

Columns.Name: ContractWarehouseIndicator
Columns.Description:
A contract warehouse is a business that handles shipping, receiving, and storage of products on a contract basis.  

Contract warehouses will generally require a client to commit to a specific period of time (generally in years) for the services.  

Contracts may or may not require clients to purchase or subsidize storage and material-handling equipment.  

Fees for contract warehouses may be transaction and storage based, fixed, cost plus, or any combination.

Columns.Name: StoreId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Store.

Columns.Name: CustomerId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Customer.

Columns.Name: CustomerOwnedWarehouseIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates whether the customer owns the warehouse.

Columns.Name: CustomerManagedWarehouseIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates whether the customer manages the warehouse.

Columns.Name: InventoryOwnedByCustomerIndicator
Columns.Description: Indicates whether the inventory stored at the warehouse inventory location is owned by the customer.

Columns.Name: WarehouseTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a warehouse type.

NewEntity.Name: WarehouseItemOrder
NewEntity.Description: An order that is used to procure items for the associated warehouse.

Columns.Name: WarehouseId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Warehouse.

Columns.Name: OrderId
Columns.Description: The unique number that identifies an Order.

Columns.Name: Quantity
Columns.Description: The quantity of items that will drawn from the associated warehouse.
